section.title: Introduction
section.para: T1DMine is an open-source project to build an integrated data warehouse for Type I Diabetes and Stem Cell projects as part of the CMI Systems Biology KIC.

Currently, biological data is stored in a wide variety of formats in numerous different places, making complex queries across these data sources very difficult. In addition it is often possible to make stronger inferences when data are combined and analysed together. One of the current challenges for bioinformatics is therefore to develop resources for the integration and combined analysis of such data.

T1DMine is built on InterMine and FlyMine. InterMine is a general purpose object-oriented data warehouse system developed as part of the FlyMine project. FlyMine is built using InterMine with primary focus on Drosophila, Anopheles and other insects. T1DMine is adapting the FlyMine data integration architecture to integrate genomics and genetics data from human, mouse and rat as part of efforts to study this complex disease. Currently we have integrated the Ensembl human genome annotation, GO annotation, FirstEF, Transfac binding sites and Encode regions from UCSC and disease regions from DIL (Diabetes and Inflammation Laboratory). These have been merged with the sequence ontology data model into a single query-optimised object database. Users are able to create complex, powerful, arbitrary queries on the integrated data via an intuitive web application or access the data via simpler predefined template queries.
T1DMine is in continuous development and please check technical desciption for further details.
